content.question:
In addition to the <math alttext="A B O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ABO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> blood groups, humans have an <math alttext="M N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>MN</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> blood type system in which the <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> alleles are codominant to one another. These alleles code for glycoproteins that act as antigens on the red blood cells. Scientists determined the frequencies of the <math alttext="M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>N</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> alleles in three localized and stable human populations in the Philippines.Â In Isabela, M and N alleles had a frequency of .8 and .21, respectively. Butuan had M and N allele frequencies of .82 and .18, respectively. Metro Manila had M and N allele frequencies of .55 and .51, respectively.

Which of the following would most affect the allelic frequencies of the populations on Isabela and Butuan?

choices.label: Migration of individuals between the Isabela and Butuan populations
Immigration of individuals from Metro Manila into the two populations
Increased population sizes over time in the Isabela population, but no change in the Butuan population

content.answer: Immigration of individuals from Metro Manila into the two populations
